text: Brookville is a city in Saline County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 247 people lived there. ==History== Brookville was planned out in 1870 when the Kansas Pacific Railway was built to that point. The first post office in Brookville was created in February 1870. ==Geography== Brookville is at (38.773464, -97.868015). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Climate=== Brookville has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Brookville has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Brookville, Kansas ==People== It is part of the Salina Micropolitan Statistical Area. ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 247 people, 92 households, and 62 families living in Brookville. Of the households, 78.3% owned their home and 21.7% rented their home. The median age was 35.9 years. Of the people, 92.3% were White, 1.6% were Native American, 0.4% were Asian, 0.8% were from some other race, and 4.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 3.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 262 people, 101 households, and 72 families living in Brookville. ===2000 census=== The 2000 census says that there were 259 people, 104 households, and 74 families living in Brookville. ==Education== Brookville is a part of USD 307 Ell-Saline.USD 307Kansas School District Boundary Map Saline County School District Map ==In popular culture== One scene of the 1980 film Up the Academy was filmed in Brookville, where the boys drive off without paying for fuel. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Brookville - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 307, local school district ;Historical * Brookville Hotel removed from Historic Register ;Maps * Brookville City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Saline County, Kansas
